data: Bonnie Fleming Bonnie Fleming Professor of Physics / Director of Graduate Studies She/her/hers WL 212 203-432-3235 bonnie.fleming@yale.edu Experimental Nuclear and Particle Physics Our group, headed by Prof. Bonnie Fleming, studies neutrinos. We are largely an experimental group focusing on new physics in the neutrino sector. In the near term, we are working on the ArgoNeuT, LArIAT, MicroBooNE, and SBND experiments at Fermilab. In the long term, we are pursuing searches for CP Violation in the neutrino sector with the DUNE experiment.  Concurrently, we are developing the next generation of accelerator neutrino detectors for these programs – Liquid Argon Time Projection Chambers. Ph.D., Columbia University, 2002 Bonnie Fleming Bonnie Fleming Professor of Physics +1 (203) 432-3235 bonnie.fleming@yale.edu
